error_details.explanation: Incorrect operation. The calculation should use '/' but used '-' instead.

context.question: N/A
context.flawed_solution:
#### 168
Brian requires a total of $3.5 + $3.5 = $<<3.5+3.5=7>>7 to pay for the round trip subway fare
We also know he has spent half (1/2) the amount he spent on kiwis on bananas, so he'll spend (1/2) * $10 = $5 on bananas
So far in total he has spent $7 for his subway fare + $5 on bananas + $10 on kiwis = $7 + $5 + $10 = $<<7+5+10=22>>22
If he left his house with only $50, then all he will have left for apples would be $50 - $22 = $<<50-22=28>>28
If a bag of apples costs $14, then Brian would only be able to buy a maximum of $28/$14 = 14 bags of apples
If each bag of apples has a dozen (12) apples, then (14) two bags will have 12*14= <<14*12=168>>168 apples
